intro: Erica acutangula, commonly known as the narrow-leaved heath, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and related shrubs. This evergreen shrub typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to coastal and mountainous regions. Its small, needle-like leaves and clusters of pink or white flowers make it a striking addition to gardens. It is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained conditions.
